page.title: 04FISHERMENS FRIENDS,FLEETWOOD
page.content: The Lofthouse lozenge was developed in Fleetwood in 1865 by James Lofthouse. It was developed for trawler men to ease their bronchial ailments. They were a success but were not sold commercially until 1963. In 1972 a Lofthouse factory in Fleetwood was opened by Sir Walter Clegg M.P.It employed 15 people but now employs 140.It is expanding all the time. The basic ingredients are sugar menthol and aniseed.They make a variety of{Fishermens Friends};Extra Strong,Original,Aniseed,Peppermint and Sugar Free. Lofthouse export 1,200 million lozenges per annum,and have recently been awarded the{"Queen's Award for {Exports".}The main markets are Norway, The Netherlands,U.S.A.,Italy,Germany, Denmark,Sweden,Australia and Austria.
